intro: Physaria kingii subsp. cobrensis, commonly known as the cobrensis bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many mustard plants, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and inflated seed pods. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, alternate leaves and produces numerous small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The subspecies cobrensis is distinguished by its unique morphological features, including the shape and size of its seed pods.
